title: Bootstrap Validation
subject: Bootstrap
theory:
## Ensuring Correct Data
Bootstrap provides styles for valid/invalid states.

### Classes
* `.is-valid`: Green border and checkmark.
* `.is-invalid`: Red border and exclamation mark.

### Feedback
* `.valid-feedback` / `.invalid-feedback`: Text shown only when parent input is in that state.

### JavaScript
Bootstrap can hijack the standard HTML5 validation API to apply these classes automatically.

examples.code: Please provide a valid city.
examples.output: Red input with error message below.

common_mistakes.correction: Feedback divs are hidden by default. They only appear if the sibling input has `.is-valid` or `.is-invalid` class (or if parent form has `.was-validated`).

real_world_use_cases.description: Real-time checking if username is taken.

summary: Validation styles provide crucial feedback to users, ensuring data integrity before submission.
